channel.title: Comments on: Nest Thermostat Review, Update #3

item.title: By: Bob Blanchette
item.dc:creator: Bob Blanchette
item.description: Jeff, look into the ecobee. It will do humidity and wifi.
item.content:encoded: Jeff, look into the ecobee. It will do humidity and wifi.

item.title: By: Jeff
item.dc:creator: Jeff
item.description: I know there are some thermostats that do both. I was just looking to see if others had successfully set-up the configuration you described with the humidifier running independent of the Nest. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: I know there are some thermostats that do both. I was just looking to see if others had successfully set-up the configuration you described with the humidifier running independent of the Nest. Thanks!

item.title: By: WiredPrairie - My Nest Thermostat installation experience
item.dc:creator: WiredPrairie - My Nest Thermostat installation experience

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1360/comment-page-1#comment-3775">Jeff</a>.
Jeff -- are you looking for one device that does both? Our whole house humidifier from Aprilaire is connected to the furnace. We just set a humidity on it and let it go. It runs when it needs to (of course, only when the furnace is running).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jeff.

Jeff — are you looking for one device that does both? Our whole house humidifier from Aprilaire is connected to the furnace. We just set a humidity on it and let it go. It runs when it needs to (of course, only when the furnace is running).

item.title: By: Jeff
item.dc:creator: Jeff
item.description: I'm thinking about purchasing 2 Nests for my house that is under construction. We'll have a whole house humidifier, which the Nest can't control and wondering if you guys know of any systems that will control humidity and let Nest control temperature?
item.content:encoded: I’m thinking about purchasing 2 Nests for my house that is under construction. We’ll have a whole house humidifier, which the Nest can’t control and wondering if you guys know of any systems that will control humidity and let Nest control temperature?

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1360/comment-page-1#comment-3766">dwayne</a>.
I've not seen any indication of a low temp alarm/email. It does "know" my email address and has a minimum temperature setting as the "away setting." So, I suppose it's possible that it could use my e-mail if the temperature falls much below the low "away" setting, but I don't recall hearing about that.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to dwayne.

I’ve not seen any indication of a low temp alarm/email. It does “know” my email address and has a minimum temperature setting as the “away setting.” So, I suppose it’s possible that it could use my e-mail if the temperature falls much below the low “away” setting, but I don’t recall hearing about that.

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1360/comment-page-1#comment-3766">dwayne</a>.
We live in Southern Wisconsin. Our house is around 3900 sqft over three floors.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to dwayne.

We live in Southern Wisconsin. Our house is around 3900 sqft over three floors.
